Interface_name: Advanced HTTP client with custom http.Client and request headers
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Go HTTP client struct that can handle both HTTP and HTTPS requests with custom configurations, including authentication and request headers.

Struct Description: The Client struct represents an HTTP client with configurable protocol, address, authentication, and transport settings. It provides methods to execute HTTP requests and handle responses.

Fields:
Protocol: string - The protocol to use (http or https)
Addr: string - The server address to connect to
User: string - The username for basic authentication
Password: string - The password for basic authentication
c: *http.Client - The underlying HTTP client instance

Methods:
NewClient: (conf *ClientConfig) -> *Client - Creates a new Client instance with the given configuration, setting up either HTTP or HTTPS transport
DoRequest: (method string, url string, body *bytes.Buffer) -> (*http.Response, error) - Executes an HTTP request with the given method, URL and body, adding basic auth if configured
Do: (method string, url string, body map[string]interface{}) -> (*Response, error) - Executes a request with JSON body, parses the response and returns a structured Response object
